TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Tab/TabItemBothEdges extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a for a tab control that shares its top border with another tab control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Tab.TabItemBothEdges.Normal%2A> property of the VisualStyleElement.Tab.TabItemBothEdges class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents a tab control that shares its top border with another tab control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Tab.TabItemBothEdges.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTabTabItemBothEdges1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#121](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_28_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#121](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_28_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a tab control that shares its top border with another tab control.
Docs.value: A that represents a tab control that shares its top border with another tab control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementTabTabItemBothEdges1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#121](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/a4af5b21-373a-4acb-a8c2-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#121](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/a4af5b21-373a-4acb-a8c2-_1.vb)]
